document_data.name: Ahs Trango Shan
document_data.mainbody: '''Ahs Trango Shan''', or the '''South Guardian Peak''', was a mountain located in [[Khazari]].
document_data.Geography: The South Guardian Peak formed part of the natural border of eastern Khazari, along with the [[Nas Trango Shan]], providing a rocky barrier against [[Kara-Tur]] and the outside world.
document_data.Description:
At {{SI|15641|ft}}, the South Guardian Peak was the smaller of two peaks located in eastern Khazari. The [[Broken Wall Pass]] ran between the two peaks.

Strong fortifications, in the form of fort [[Luntse Dzong]], were present to ensure the protection of the valuable [[Silk Road]] that passed through the mountains.
document_data.Inhabitants: Bandits, led by [[Brusha]] around [[1359 DR]], and dangerous creatures inhabited the valleys surrounding the base of the mountains.
